bibl.title: Letter from Richard Messer to Henry Rose Carter, May 31, 1921

div1.p: Messer sends Carter a report of the malaria control committee, which Gage will present at the Boston meeting.

div1.head: Letter from Richard Messer to Henry Rose Carter, May 31, 1921
div1.opener:
Malaria-- State Sanitary Engineers' Association.
ENNION G. WILLIAMS, M. D.
STATE HEALTH COMMISSIONER
ROY K. FLANNAGAN, M. D.
ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER
RICHARD MESSER
CHIEF ENGINEER
M. E. BRYDON, M. D.
DIRECTOR CHILD WELFARE
Mal
Report Va
Messer.
Commonwealth of Virginia
STATE BOARD OF HEALTH
RICHMOND
May 31, 1921.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Dr. Carter:-
div1.p:
You may be interested in having the report
of our committee appointed by the State Sanitary Engineers'
Association on Malaria Control. As you probably know the meet-
ing is being held this week in Boston.

A great deal of the credit for this report be-
longs to Mr. E. H. Gage (International Health Board) and Dr.
Griffitts, who helped me prepare the questionnaire and also summar-
ize the data which we received from the various states and made
other very valuable suggestions.

It so happens that it is impossible for me to
attend the meeting in Boston and I have asked Mr. Gage to take
the report along with him and present it before the Association.
Incidentally, he has been doing some mighty fine work in the state
during the past year.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Richard Messer
Chief Engineer. Richard Messer
AG
Encl. 1.
